subject: Introduction of provisions of Dispute Review Board (DRB) in ongoing PPP projects
text: HRT 7e4 TTHrf nfeqrut 7h14 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (s* 4de7 3k {TTHTf 4A1q4) W4& / Fax ; 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 3-5 & 6, Teer-10 , ERoT, T feit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI Policy Guidelines/Dispute Resolution & Legal Matters/ 2020 No.2.1.37 /2020 dated the March, 2020 [Decision taken on File of Legal Division] Sub:- Introduction of provisions of Dispute Review Board (DRB) in ongoing PPP projects. Competent Authority has decided to introduce Dispute Review Board (DRB) wherein dispute (s) will be heard and decided by three eminent senior retired technical officers having experience in handling the type of works involved in the project. One member is selected by, each the Employer and the Concessionaire and third mel ber/ Chairman of DRB shall be selected by other two members from the list provided by the Authority. 2_ In order to implement the decision of Competent Authority a supplementary agreement for ongoing PPP contracts/projects would be signed for which following documents are enclosed. of supplementary agreement to be entered between the Employer and the Concessionaire on Rs. 100 / - non judicial stamp paper (two originals) _ (ii) of Rules and procedure of DRB (iii) of declaratiol form by the DRB member (iv) of fee structure of DRB members. 3_ All CGMs (Tech) , HQ are therefore advised to enter into a Supplementary Agreement by 31.03.2020 positively with the Concessionaire/ Contractor for ongoing PPP projects falling under their jurisdiction. 4.
